subject: Real Estate
title: London: Where History Meets Billionaires
description: One-minute skill: London: Where History Meets Billionaires.

hook.text: A parking space in London's Knightsbridge sold for $445,000. A single parking space.

buildup.text: London has been a global capital hub for centuries. Property there is treated as the safest store of value.

discovery.text: Russian oligarchs, Gulf royals, and tech billionaires turned prime London into the world's priciest market.

twist.text: Brexit was supposed to crash London prices. They dipped â€” then recovered. Global demand is nearly indestructible.

climax.text: London proves that world-class cities operate outside local economics. Global money sets the price.

punchline.text: In London, even a parking space costs more than most homes.

quiz.question: What effect did Brexit have on London property prices?
